div.p: Greetings. I received your letter written on July 24th.

However, since these days I am suffering from a domestic and severe headache, I am writing nothing now except that I received your letter and thank you for your diligence. The Lord has removed the king by manifest judgment, who wanted to lay a heavy hand on the church of God. May the Lord grant that the counselors of Francis recognize this, to whom I wish all happiness.

Commend me to Mr. Legate, the honorable councilors, Mr. Gallicius, Pontasella, and all good people. I ask you to diligently ensure that this is delivered by Mr. Friedrich, who ordered it to be sent to Samaden, where he is now.
To the most excellent man, Mr. Johannes Fabricius, announcer of Christ in Chur of the Rhaetians, his compatriot and dearest brother. Chur.
